requirements:
An e-commerce platform manages products, customers, and orders.
Each product has a unique SKU, name, description, price, and stock quantity.
Products can be categorized, and a product can belong to multiple categories.
Customers have an email, password, shipping address, and billing address.
Each customer can place multiple orders, and each order contains one or more order items.
An order has an order date, status (pending, shipped, delivered, cancelled), and total amount.
Each order item links a product to an order with a quantity and unit price at time of purchase.
Customers can add products to a shopping cart before placing an order.
The system tracks payment information including payment method, transaction ID, and payment status.

A university manages students, courses, and instructors.
Each student has a student ID, name, email, date of birth, and major.
Instructors have an employee ID, name, email, department, and hire date.
Courses have a course code, title, credits, and description.
A course is taught by one instructor, but an instructor can teach multiple courses.
Students can enroll in multiple courses, and each course can have multiple students enrolled.
Enrollment records track the semester, year, and grade received.
Courses have prerequisites which are other courses that must be completed first.
The system tracks course sections with section number, semester, year, classroom, and meeting time.
Each section is of a specific course and taught by one instructor.

A library system manages books, members, and loans.
Books have an ISBN, title, author, publisher, publication year, and availability status.
Members have a membership ID, name, address, phone number, and registration date.
The library has different types of members: students and faculty members.
Students have a student ID and program of study.
Faculty members have an employee ID and department.
Members can borrow multiple books, and each book can be borrowed by different members over time.
A loan records the checkout date, due date, and return date.
The system tracks fines for late returns with fine amount and payment status.
Books can be reserved by members when they are currently on loan.

A hotel manages rooms, guests, and reservations.
Rooms have a room number, floor, room type (single, double, suite), price per night, and status.
Guests have a guest ID, name, email, phone number, and address.
Reservations link guests to rooms for specific dates with check-in date, check-out date, and total cost.
The hotel offers different room types with specific amenities and maximum occupancy.
Guests can make multiple reservations, and each room can have multiple reservations over time.
The system tracks payments with payment date, amount, and payment method.
Services such as room service, laundry, and spa can be charged to a reservation.
Each service has a service name, description, and price.

A hospital manages patients, doctors, and appointments.
Patients have a patient ID, name, date of birth, blood type, and medical history.
Doctors have a doctor ID, name, specialization, and years of experience.
The hospital has different types of doctors: general practitioners and specialists.
Appointments are scheduled between patients and doctors with appointment date, time, reason, and status.
Patients can have multiple appointments, and doctors can have appointments with multiple patients.
Medical records track diagnoses, prescriptions, and treatment plans for each appointment.
Prescriptions include medication name, dosage, frequency, and duration.
The hospital has departments, and each doctor belongs to one department.
Departments have a department name, location, and head of department.

A car rental company manages vehicles, customers, and rental agreements.
Vehicles have a registration number, make, model, year, color, and daily rental rate.
There are different types of vehicles: sedans, SUVs, and trucks.
Sedans have number of doors and fuel efficiency.
SUVs have seating capacity and drivetrain type (2WD or 4WD).
Trucks have payload capacity and bed length.
Customers have a license number, name, phone number, and email.
Rental agreements specify pickup date, return date, pickup location, return location, and total cost.
Each rental agreement involves one customer and one vehicle.
The system tracks insurance coverage for rentals with coverage type and premium amount.
Maintenance records track service date, service type, cost, and mileage for each vehicle.

A social media platform manages users, posts, and interactions.
Users have a username, email, password, profile picture URL, and bio.
Users can create posts with content, timestamp, and visibility (public or private).
Posts can contain text, images, or videos with corresponding URLs.
Users can follow other users, creating a follower/following relationship.
Users can like and comment on posts.
Comments have comment text, timestamp, and can be replies to other comments.
Users can send direct messages to other users.
Messages have message text, timestamp, and read status.
The system tracks user activity with login history including login time and IP address.

An airline manages flights, passengers, and bookings.
Flights have a flight number, departure airport, arrival airport, departure time, arrival time, and aircraft type.
Passengers have a passport number, name, date of birth, nationality, and contact information.
Bookings link passengers to flights with booking reference, booking date, and seat number.
There are different ticket classes: economy, business, and first class, each with different prices.
Passengers can have multiple bookings, and each flight can have multiple passengers.
The system tracks baggage with baggage tag number, weight, and status.
Each booking can have multiple baggage items associated with it.
Crew members are assigned to flights with role (pilot, co-pilot, flight attendant).
Crew members have an employee ID, name, and years of service.
